review.title: Causes for Query Answers from Databases: Datalog Abduction, View-Updates, and Integrity Constraints
review.abstract: Causality has been recently introduced in databases, to model, characterize, and possibly compute causes for query answers. Connections between QA-causality and consistency-based diagnosis and database repairs (wrt. integrity constraint violations) have already been established. In this work we establish precise connections between QA-causality and both abductive diagnosis and the view-update problem in databases, allowing us to obtain new algorithmic and complexity results for QA-causality. We also obtain new results on the complexity of view-conditioned causality, and investigate the notion of QA-causality in the presence of integrity constraints, obtaining complexity results from a connection with view-conditioned causality. The abduction connection under integrity constraints allows us to obtain algorithmic tools for QA-causality.

sections.heading: 8. Discussion and Conclusions
sections.text: In this paper, we have investigated the calculation aspects of causality for responses to Datalog queries, which has been made possible by establishing precise relationships (mutual reductions) with adjunctions from Datalog theories. This link is interesting in itself. In particular, the notion of necessity-degree for abductive explanations, motivated by causality concepts, has been identified as relevant (see Section 4.3). We have also explored in detail the relationships between query-response causality for monotonous queries and updates through views defined by monotonsequences. Of particular relevance is our investigation of viewrelated causality, for which we established links with the viewside effect-free deletion problem. We have achieved new complexity results for both problems. The problem of causality under Integrity Restrictions (ICs) has not been investigated so far.

metadata.abstractText: Causality has been recently introduced in databases, to model, characterize, and possibly compute causes for query answers. Connections between QAcausality and consistency-based diagnosis and database repairs (wrt. integrity constraint violations) have already been established. In this work we establish precise connections between QA-causality and both abductive diagnosis and the view-update problem in databases, allowing us to obtain new algorithmic and complexity results for QA-causality. We also obtain new results on the complexity of view-conditioned causality, and investigate the notion of QA-causality in the presence of integrity constraints, obtaining complexity results from a connection with view-conditioned causality. The abduction connection under integrity constraints allows us to obtain algorithmic tools for QA-causality.
